Description: Typical range for industrial cleaning of nickel-based superalloys like Hastelloy to remove contaminants without ablation; starting at 200W balances efficiency and safety to avoid thermal damage given Hastelloy's high melting point (~1350°C). Max limited to prevent substrate melting at high fluences. Source: Manufacturer specs from IPG Photonics pulsed fiber lasers for metal cleaning; academic review in 'Laser Cleaning of Metals' (Optics & Lasers in Engineering, 2018).
Near-infrared wavelength optimized for Hastelloy absorption and minimal reflectivity
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning with adequate energy density
Optimal repetition rate for continuous cleaning coverage with thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for efficient contaminant removal with controlled thermal effects
Optimal scanning speed for efficient area coverage with effective cleaning
Recommended number of passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning without excessive thermal accumulation
